intro: Gussonea friesii, commonly known as the Fries' gussonea, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, which is commonly referred to as the ice plant family. The plant is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and produces small, star-shaped flowers. It typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to arid environments. Gussonea friesii is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its unique appearance and resilience.
